reviews.text: The bedroom's ocean view from upstairs in magnificent. You can hear the ocean and see the stars from your bed at hight - about as dreamy and relaxing as it gets for a New York getaway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the prices they charge they should be able to afford some renovations. Look elsewhere in Montauk which is a great spot to chill.
reviews.title: Surf Club was a great place for us to stay in Montauk!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights towards the end of August at The Surf Club, and really enjoyed our time there! From reading previous unhappy reviews, I was a bit wary of what to expect, but we really did not have a bad experience at all. We rented a 1-br garden view duplex, #9 (but you could actually see some of the ocean from our bedroom window), and the trip started off on a good foot when Bill, the General manager, was very amenable to being flexible on his minimum stay policy. We were able to stay for 3 nights (not 4) at a reduced rate. I know the economy is suffering right now, but this was still a nice deal, and frankly, what made it affordable for us.
reviews.title: disgusting infested with ants and horrible service

reviews.text: We took advantage of the fully stocked kitchen (stovetop, oven, full fridge/freezer, dishes, utensils, cookery, tea kettle, glasses) and cooked every breakfast and lunch for ourselves. We also cooked two dinners at home (one with fresh flounder from Gosman's Fish Market), and had a lovely dinner on the Docks at Dave's Grill.
reviews.title: To be honest? Crap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was perfectly comfortable, as was the living room. Flat-screen TV downstairs; older, smaller model upstairs. No DVD player in either room, sadly. Unlike another reader, we had cable TV and HBO on both televisions. No wi-fi either, but that is okay, because The Surf Club does not advertise that it has wifi at all. Within walking distance to the Main St. area, and steps from the gorgeous beach (we checked out beach towels and umbrellas from poolside, and enjoyed some time down by the waves). One tiny thing: the screen insert in the front screen door was loose, so we couldn't keep the front door open to get a breeze, for fear of letting in mosquitoes, etc. But that's a tiny detail!
reviews.title: The Surf Club is not what it used to be...

reviews.text: Location, Location, Location. When you want the beach, this is what you want, and generally you will put up with a few inconveniences.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleanliness. Our unit was newly furnished, including carpeting. After reading other reviews, I think we just lucked out. Bathroom was a good size and stocked with great towels and very clean.
reviews.title: Rude & defensive front desk

reviews.text: It cost over $500.00 a nite you must stay 4 nights which we were fine with the cost and time had it been what is advertised. There is no HBO and There is no WIFI traveling with a teenager they need the internet. They said if i had a cord i could use the telephone line dial-up for 10.00 a day. It was private and quite those were the good things. People were lighting bonfires on the beach so you had to shut your windows the smoke filled our rooms. The bed was extremely worn out very uncomfortable! The place was very small though it has two floors they were tight. It would be ok for a couple. It was musty. We don't get away often we work alot so for us to finally get away i was so sad and felt ripped off. DONT GO IT COST $ 2137.00 FOR 4 SAD NIGHTS AND THERES NOTHING YOU CAN DO THERES NO REFUND!!! Buyer Beware!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: sooooo disappointed.......I wish i could hit rewind and make a different choice.

reviews.text: My young son and I went to the Surf Club for a short vacation get-a-away. Everything about our stay was perfect. Easy and friendly check in...clean and efficient duplexes...great pool...steps to the beach, with includes poolside assistance to bring towels, beach chairs and umbrellas to the beach...within walking distance to town. We had a great time and made some everlasting memories. We will be back every year!!!
reviews.title: Love It!!!!!

reviews.text: This is our second trip to Montauk and we love it! Montauk, unlike the Hamptons, is not as polished which adds to the natural and very dramatic beauty. We love the casual beachy feel of the town and feel like it lends itself to really relaxing. This is our second stay at the Surf Club and given the choice of accommodations in Montauk, this is definitely your best bet by a long shot! To begin, the oceanfront accommodations are great - the view of the ocean past the natural fauna is gorgeous and the sound of the waves is medication for the soul. The townhouses are a mini version of all you need while you are at the beach. We especially liked the little patio facing the ocean to eat our breakfast and lunch. Great to have a small kitchen so you don't have to eat every meal out. Pool is very nice and warm. Love that the resort provides beach towels and chairs. Montauk surf is awesome - and the even though is was very overcast the kids still had a ball playing on the sand. We love that you can walk to town from the resort and we did so everyday. Some great spots to eat in Montauk; loved breakfast at Jodis and dinner at Harvest and who cannot love eating lobster at Dureyeas (sp?) where you BYOB and look out on the water! Anyway, my feeling is that location, convenience, view and cleanliness are the most important considerations when choosing a beach spot, doesnt have to be luxurious as we want to be outside as much as possible. Surf Club has all of those features and it is a great place to enjoy all that Montauk has to offer!
reviews.title: Montauk: A little piece of unspoiled heaven!

reviews.text: I spent alot of time researching a place to stay in Montauk that was clean and appropriate for a family with a young child-the Surf Club is definitely that place. We rented a 1 bedroom, ocean front duplex for a week in June. It was perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The unit was very clean. It had a full kitchen (with dishwasher) and was stocked with everything you could need (paper towels, sponge, soap, dish towel, coffee maker w/filters, dishes-pots-utensils, etc.). Flat screen TV's upstairs and down-the downstairs one had a VCR and DVD player. The bed was not that uncomfortable-I was expecting worse. The resort had towels, chairs and umbrellas that you could use for the beach. The pool was very clean and warm. My husband used the steam bath a number of times.
reviews.title: Best experience ever!!!!!!
